text: The fuselage (from the French fusel√©, meaning "spindle-shaped") is the main body section of an aircraft. It holds the crew and passengers or cargo, as well as an engine in many cases. It is often made out of a metal, such as aluminium. ==Other websites== *NASA page on fuselage *Institute of Aircraft Design and Lightweight Structures (IFL) Category:Aircraft
title: Fuselage
